faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our AI code migration services
faq.q1: Do I need to share my source code to benefit from AI2H service?
faq.a1: No, not on first contact. Let's discuss first, depending on your needs you may or may not share access to your code. For a migration need, AI2H will need access to your code.
faq.q2: Can I choose which service to migrate to?
faq.a2: Yes! However, AI2H proposes to study with you which services to prioritize. We choose the best qualified services according to your product's needs.
faq.q3: Will I still be able to use AIs for my product's code?
faq.a3: Yes, always with your favorite AI services.
faq.q4: My code is stuck, can you help me?
faq.a4Rest: ! Let's exchange 15 minutes to unblock your situation. Source code sharing is not necessary.

manifesto.title: AI2H Manifesto
manifesto.subtitle: Our vision to free software development from AI dependency
manifesto.whyP1: Artificial intelligence has revolutionized software development, but it has also created a new form of dependency. Developers and companies find themselves trapped by expensive subscriptions, generated code they don't understand, and solutions that distance them from their technical autonomy.
manifesto.whyP2: At AI2H, we believe it's time to take back control. This manifesto sets out our vision for free, autonomous and sustainable software development.
manifesto.principle1Text: A developer must understand and master their code. AI must be a tool, not a master. We migrate your generated code to human code that you can read, modify and maintain.
manifesto.principle2Text: AI subscriptions create growing financial dependency. Our unique migration permanently frees you from these recurring costs by transforming your AI code into code you fully own.
manifesto.principle3Text: AI-generated code is often functional but rarely optimal. We transform your code into a robust, performant solution that's easy to maintain over the long term.
manifesto.principle4Text: Every line of migrated code is explained, documented and delivered with complete training. You understand what you're getting and how to use it.
manifesto.missionQuote: Free every developer and every company from AI dependency by giving them the means to own, understand and master their technology.
manifesto.fight1Text: AI subscriptions that accumulate and create growing, unpredictable financial burden.
manifesto.fight2Text: Generated code that no one understands, creating technical and maintenance risks.
manifesto.fight3Text: Technological dependency that distances teams from their business expertise.
manifesto.fight4Text: Prototypes that remain prototypes, without evolution towards sustainable solutions.
manifesto.solutionDescription: A unique approach that permanently transforms your AI code into human code, making you autonomous and free from any dependency.
manifesto.solutionStep1Text: Complete understanding of your AI code and your business needs
manifesto.solutionStep2Text: Transformation into optimized, documented and maintainable human code
manifesto.ctaText: If you share our vision of free and autonomous software development, if you're tired of accumulating subscriptions and code you don't master, then you're ready for AI2H migration.

audit.title: Security Audit
audit.emailSuccess: Email sent successfully! Check your inbox.
audit.emailPatternTitle: Only letters, numbers, dots, dashes and underscores are allowed
audit.emailHelp: For security reasons, the email must be on the same domain as the audited site.
audit.emailFailedRetry: Failed to send email. Please try again.
audit.noFindings: No medium or low severity findings detected.
audit.aboutDescription: This audit focuses on common security issues that LLMs often miss when producing code.
audit.whyQuestion: Why don't I have access to the full audit?
audit.whyAnswer: Critical vulnerabilities on the site may be discovered. Following responsible disclosure principles, a full report is only sent to an email address registered under your site's domain.

missing_hsts.title: Missing Strict-Transport-Security header
missing_hsts.description: The site does not enforce HTTPS via HSTS, which could allow downgrade attacks.

insecure_hsts.title: Insecure HSTS configuration
insecure_hsts.description: The HSTS header is present but missing the max-age directive.

missing_csp.title: Missing Content-Security-Policy header
missing_csp.description: The site has no CSP header, which helps prevent XSS attacks.

missing_content_type_options.title: Missing X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header
missing_content_type_options.description: The site does not prevent MIME type sniffing, which could lead to security issues.

missing_frame_protection.title: Missing clickjacking protection
missing_frame_protection.description: The site has no X-Frame-Options or frame-ancestors in CSP, which could allow clickjacking attacks.

version_leak_server.title: Server version leak
version_leak_server.description: The Server header exposes software version information that could help attackers find known exploits.

version_leak_powered_by.title: X-Powered-By version leak
version_leak_powered_by.description: The X-Powered-By header exposes software version information that could help attackers find known exploits.

insecure_cookie_secure.title: Cookie without Secure flag
insecure_cookie_secure.description: The cookie is set on HTTPS but missing the Secure flag, which could allow it to be sent over HTTP.

insecure_cookie_httponly.title: Cookie without HttpOnly flag
insecure_cookie_httponly.description: The cookie is accessible via JavaScript, which could allow XSS attacks to steal it.

insecure_cookie_samesite.title: Cookie SameSite=None without Secure
insecure_cookie_samesite.description: The cookie has SameSite=None but is missing the Secure flag, which is required for cross-site cookies.

missing_cookie_samesite.title: Cookie without SameSite attribute
missing_cookie_samesite.description: The cookie has no SameSite attribute defined, which could allow CSRF attacks.

cors_wildcard.title: CORS allows all origins
cors_wildcard.description: The site allows requests from any origin via CORS wildcard, which could allow malicious sites to make requests on behalf of users.

cors_credentials_with_wildcard.title: CORS allows credentials with wildcard/reflected origin
cors_credentials_with_wildcard.description: The site allows sending credentials with CORS while allowing all origins or reflected origins, which is a critical security flaw.

cors_reflects_origin.title: CORS reflects Origin header
cors_reflects_origin.description: The site reflects the Origin header in Access-Control-Allow-Origin, which could allow any site to make requests.

sensitive_file_exposed.title: Sensitive file exposed
sensitive_file_exposed.description: A sensitive file is publicly accessible, which could expose secrets, configuration, or source code.

directory_listing_enabled.title: Directory listing enabled
directory_listing_enabled.description: Directory listing is enabled, which could expose file structure and sensitive files.

leaked_secret_stripe_key.title: Potential Stripe Live secret key leak
leaked_secret_stripe_key.description: A potential Stripe Live secret key leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_stripe_test.title: Potential Stripe Test secret key leak
leaked_secret_stripe_test.description: A potential Stripe Test secret key leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_google_api.title: Potential Google API key leak
leaked_secret_google_api.description: A potential Google API key leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_aws_access.title: Potential AWS access key ID leak
leaked_secret_aws_access.description: A potential AWS access key ID leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_aws_secret.title: Potential AWS secret access key leak
leaked_secret_aws_secret.description: A potential AWS secret access key leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_client_secret.title: Potential OAuth client secret leak
leaked_secret_client_secret.description: A potential OAuth client secret leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_private_key.title: Potential private key leak
leaked_secret_private_key.description: A potential private key leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_api_key.title: Potential API key leak
leaked_secret_api_key.description: A potential API key leak was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

leaked_secret_password.title: Potential password in code
leaked_secret_password.description: A potential password in code was found in the page source code or JavaScript files.

robots_txt_sensitive_paths.title: robots.txt reveals sensitive paths
robots_txt_sensitive_paths.description: The robots.txt file contains disallowed paths, which could reveal hidden admin panels, API endpoints, or sensitive directories.

verbose_error_500.title: Verbose error messages on 500 error
verbose_error_500.description: The server returns detailed error information in 500 responses, which could leak sensitive information about code paths, database structure, or server technologies.

sql_injection_anomaly.title: Potential SQL injection vulnerability
sql_injection_anomaly.description: Sending a simple quote (') caused a 500 error with database-specific error messages, indicating a potential SQL injection vulnerability.

reflected_xss.title: Potential reflected XSS vulnerability
reflected_xss.description: User input is reflected in the HTML response without proper sanitization, which could allow XSS attacks.

open_api_endpoint.title: Potentially open API endpoint
open_api_endpoint.description: An API endpoint was found that returns JSON data without authentication. This may expose sensitive data and requires manual review.

insecure_form_action.title: Form action uses HTTP
insecure_form_action.description: A form action points to an HTTP URL instead of HTTPS, which would send credentials or user data in plain text.

missing_csrf_token.title: Missing CSRF token
missing_csrf_token.description: A form that performs state-changing actions (POST/PUT/DELETE/PATCH) does not appear to have a CSRF token, which could allow CSRF attacks.

email.subject: Security audit report - {{url}}
email.body: Please find attached the security audit report for the site: {{url}}
